discussion.content: Returns the version of the client from which the function was called. If called from an application using the JDBC or ODBC driver to connect to Snowflake, returns the version of the driver.

choices.C: Execute SELECT CURRENT_CLIENT(); from an application
choices.D: Execute SELECT CURRENT-VERSION(); from the Python Connector
choices.A: Execute SELECT CURRENT_ODBC_CLIENT(); from the Web UI

questions.question_text: Which of the following SQL statements will list the version of the drivers currently being used?

choices.C: Download data files from Snowflake internal stages to a local directory/folder.
choices.B: Automatically decrypt downloaded data on a client machine.
choices.D: Download data files from Snowflake external stages to a local directory/folder.

questions.question_text: What action can be performed using the GET command in Snowflake?

discussion.content:
Downloads data files from one of the following internal stage types to a local directory or folder on a client machine:

Named internal stage.

Internal stage for a specified table.

Internal stage for the current user.

Selected Answer: D
Answer is D

questions.question_text: What is the PRIMARY factor that determines the cost of using a virtual warehouse in Snowflake?

choices.A: The type of SQL statements executed
choices.D: The length of time the compute resources in each cluster run
choices.B: The number of tables or databases queried
choices.C: The amount of data stored in the warehouse

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct.
B looks to be the best answer in this case

questions.question_text: What are potential impacts of storing non-native values like dates and timestamps in a VARIANT column in Snowflake?

choices.B: Slower query performance and increased storage consumption
choices.C: Faster query performance and decreased storage consumption
choices.A: Faster query performance and increased storage consumption
choices.D: Slower query performance and decreased storage consumption

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Has anyone found these 60-ish questions sufficient for prepping for the REcertification of snowpro core? So the renewal certification exam I mean?

Selected Answer: C
When a user-level network policy is assigned, Snowflake does not immediately log the user out but enforces the policy on subsequent actions. If the user's IP address does not match the policy rules, Snowflake will block any further queries or operations from that session.

Selected Answer: C
Answer C. https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/network-policies

In addition, when a user-level network policy is associated with the user and the user is already logged into Snowflake, if the user’s network location does not match the user-level network policy rules, Snowflake prevents the user from executing further queries.

Selected Answer: A
The reason C. Prevent the user from executing additional queries is not the correct answer is because Snowflake's network policies are designed to enforce security by immediately terminating sessions that do not comply with the policy rules. When a user's IP address does not match the user-level network policy, Snowflake logs the user out to prevent any potential security risks12.

Preventing the user from executing additional queries while allowing them to remain logged in could still pose a security threat, as the user would still have an active session. Logging the user out ensures that any unauthorized access is immediately cut off.

In addition, when a user-level network policy is associated with the user and the user is already logged into Snowflake, if the user’s network location does not match the user-level network policy rules, Snowflake prevents the user from executing further queries.

questions.question_text:
A Snowflake user is actively logged into Snowflake when a user-level network policy is assigned to that user.
What will Snowflake do if the user's IP address does not match the user-level network policy rules?

choices.D: Allow the user to continue until the session or login token expires.
choices.C: Prevent the user from executing additional queries.
